intro: Symplocos brachybotrys, commonly known as the short-fruited wax myrtle, is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many acid-loving plants such as blueberries and huckleberries. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white flowers that bloom in the spring. Its berries are small, dark purple, and often remain on the plant throughout the winter. Symplocos brachybotrys is typically found in moist, well-drained soils in woodlands and along stream banks.
